error.signature: Error: Rendered more hooks than during the previous render

verdict.summary: Hooks called conditionally or in different order between renders — violates Rules of Hooks.

dead_ends.action: Using useRef to track which hooks to call
dead_ends.why_fails: Adds complexity; still violates hook ordering rules

dead_ends.action: Converting to class components to avoid hooks entirely
dead_ends.why_fails: Loses functional component benefits; class components are less ergonomic

workarounds.action: Move all hooks to the top level of the component, before any conditionals or returns
workarounds.how: Hooks must be called in the same order every render

workarounds.action: Use the eslint-plugin-react-hooks to catch violations at lint time
workarounds.how: npm install -D eslint-plugin-react-hooks — catches hook order violations automatically

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Error' indicates a React hooks rules violation, while 'Module not found' indicates a missing react-dom/client import.
Both produce similar messages, but 'hooks-rules-violation' and 'hooks-in-class-component' differ in root cause and environment context.
